subject: Attention:
body:
Attention:
This is to bring to your notice that the status of your payment has
arrived to our department and verification process/due diligence
concluded,a draft bill of 10.5M.USD covering your fund payment have
been approved for transmission.
In line with the agreement signed with the newly inaugurated
government of Nigeria, The Supreme Court will notarize Waiver
Clearance as a legal document (agreement) to remove all expenses
incurred in the course of transmission to your preferred destination.
You are required to pay NOTARIZATION FEE ONLY and court will issue
order to enable bank apply waiver of charges and transmission of your
fund US$10.5M proceed to you without additional costs/fees/charges.
Expecting to receive from you.
Yours Faithfully,
Mr. Alex Alozie,
(Chief Operating Officer)
UNITED BANK FOR AFRICA (UBA)

subject: Re:   Attention:
body:
Dear Mr. Alex Alozie,

Thank you for your email. However, I would like to clarify a few things before proceeding further.

Firstly, could you please provide more details about the payment status that has arrived at your department? What does this entail and how does it affect me?

Secondly, you mentioned a fee that needs to be paid. Could you please specify the amount of this fee and provide instructions on how to make the payment?

Lastly, could you please explain what the waiver of charges means in this context? Does it mean that once I pay the specified fee, there will be no additional costs or fees charged?

I look forward to your response.

Best wishes,
Greg

subject: Re: Attention:
body:
Attention:

Your email response is received and content noted. Regards to your
questions, the status  of your payment that arrived our department
shows that you have not received your fund yet and after verification
process/due diligence was concluded, we discovered your fund has been
approved for payment and you are listed as one among beneficiaries due
to receive their duly approved payment hence a draft bill of US$10.5M
covering your fund payment was  approved and signed for onward
transmission as you comply with the instructions in line with the
agreement.

Secondly, the mentioned fee to be paid by you beneficiary is the
NOTARIZATION FEE
 $450. ONLY and court will issue order to enable bank apply waiver of
charges and transmission of your fund US$10.5M proceed to you without
additional costs/fees/charges. Without court notarization, we, the
(issuing bank) cannot apply waiver
until it's notarized by the court as legal document making it official
and binding on the bank to adhere strictly to and never request for
fees of any kind from beneficiary until their fund is successfully
transmitted to them as they may prefer.

The fee can be sent via bank transfer, western union money transfer,
Moneygram/RIA money transfer or any other means of transfer that will
be easier for you beneficiary and that is internationally acceptable.
I shall send you payment instruction based on the means through which
you are sending so I can give you the needed to do the payment, I hope
you understand it? So, you let me know your preferred and easiest
means of sending.

Lastly, waiver implies that all other charges including, taxes levies,
handling charges, processing fees, cost of transfer (COT) etc. will
not be requested from you again once you pay notarization fee for
court to notarize waiver application as legal document (Agreement)
that all other charges be waived for you until you receive your fund.

Expecting to receive from you.

Yours Faithfully,
Mr. Alex Alozie,
(Chief Operating Officer)
UNITED BANK FOR AFRICA (UBA)
